Report E-2023090108

  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 10 gallon drum of petroleum distillates (un1268) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023081529
item.description:
Report X-2023081529

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: EAST WENATCHEE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg unloaded from trailer, package handler noticed wet staining of outer pack. Sent to QA, upon retail inspection found one box with 4 one gallon jugs of Pro-Brown coil cleaner, with one leaking contents. SDS sheet placed with inner package by shipper, sheet states LTD QTY less than 1L. No limited quantity label on outer pack, greater than 1L in package. Inner package has diamond label UN3266. Leaking contents also soaked into other inner package. DescribePack: 4 one gallon jugs in fiberboard box, one gallon jug leaking from cap. Cap is not loose and will not tighten down to stop leaking. Closure failure on the jug cap, inner seal or contact. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package trapped and taken to QA where contents inspected and stood up right so jug stopped leaking. Leaking liquid only soaked into outer pack, did not damage other packages or surroundings.

item.title: Report X-2023081422
item.description:
Report X-2023081422

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WAS THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2023080856
item.description:
Report X-2023080856

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: UNION GAP
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080856 SequenceEvent: The package was found with a wet cap and QA was informed that it was leaking. The package was properly placed in a red hazmat bin with the proper liner during overnight shift. I QA was also informed that one of the package handlers noted that the liquid from the hazmat caused a minor chemical burn that did not need hospitalization. The manager noted the injury and reported it accordingly. DescribePack: The package failure was due to the vent on the cap. The package was not placed in its correct orientation which caused this vent to leak. The cap itself was closed tightly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The plastic pail was placed upright in it correct orientation. 2. X-2023080857 SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of the trailer with a wet cap. QA was informed that the package was leaking. The package was discovered by QA by 3:30 a.m. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a vented lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bucket was placed upright in its correct orientation.

item.title: Report X-2023080847
item.description:
Report X-2023080847

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When being unloaded from the trailer, package was found to be wet and leaking. It was then removed from the package flow and brought to QA. DescribePack: One of the jugs of Nu-Brite is crushed and has leaked out ~1/3 of its contents. However, it is not leaking at this time and I cannot determine with confidence where it leaked from, though as there are no holes or current leaks the cap seems most likely. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once removed from the package flow, this package placed in a lined hazmat tote and brought to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023080842
item.description:
Report X-2023080842

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was discovered slightly stained, wet on the bottom side of the box prior to processing. Upon inspecting it proved to contain 2 x MinnFinn Max part 1 treatment and 2 x 1,380 grams of NeuFinn part 2 minnfin neutralizer. DescribePack: Two of the bottles of MinnFinn Max part 1 treatment had vented caps which had allowed its content to leak. DurationRel: 19 and MitigateEffect: After inspection this package was immediately placed inside a lined hazmat container.

item.description:
Report X-2023080989

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER WAS WORKING IN A TRAILER AND FOUND THE WET PACKAGE. IN HOUSE RESPONDER, RESPONDED TO THE INCEDNT. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS BEEN CALLED. UPON CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER SUSPECTED UNDECLARED AND CONFIRMED WITH HAZMAT HELP DESK, SULFURIC ACID PG II UN1830.

item.title: Report X-2023080921
item.description:
Report X-2023080921

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA wet and upon inspection it was found that lid on hazmat had leaked internally. Soiling all contents in box. DescribePack: the cap on bottle was loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag inside a tote.
